Reviews.Content: I had stayed here with friends in 2000 & 2003 - both time I had a wonderful experience!!! Not so this time in 2005..when we arrived ... if it wasn't one thing it was another. Our 1st room attempted to stay in had NO air conditioning & they would not provide a fan (my husband went out & bought one). The toilet did not flush either. To top it off the hotel was having work done on the roof for the week!!! The staff failed to mention this to us at the time the reservations were made & when we checked in. The staff was angry with us because we asked for a different room. We moved 2 rooms over & the air did not work & the water was off. The desk clerk told us that these problems were because the hotel was having a new roof put on. We did not stay!!! The staff gave us a hard time about refunding our money because it was not "there" fault. I felt the staff who are not fluent in english should be friendlier & understanding. We will NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Pegasus Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 123miami321
Reviews.Content: Tiny, outdated, and ugly; which would be tolerable. But then they lied about the rate!! When I made my reservation I was told a certain rate for both nights. Now they are charging me that rate Per Night! When I spoke to Sandip, the manager, he was alternatively irate, smug, and belittling, and had no interest in what I had to say. Beware the Pegasus Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PrufrockCT
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pegasus and thought it was a great. Outdated decor in the room but it was very, very clean and you just can't beat the location. Plus, the rooftop pool/hot tub is a nice bonus and the free parking just down the street was a nice extra. Lastly, the price there was significantly cheaper than other Key West accommodations on Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: KELSOSK
Reviews.Content: We went to wedding in KW we booked 10 rooms. Why else do you go to the keys? To party. All you do in a hotel is sleep! Awesome Awesome location right on corner of Duval, walking distance to all hot spots, balcony overlooks Duval street. 24 hour pizza place right next door. I say for the money it wasn't bad. I read all other reviews and wonder whats wrong with these other people? The only thing I had a problem with was that the carpet seemed a bit too cool..maybe even damp. Otherwise for the money and location I say it was a cool deal. We stayed for four days. GOTTA get some pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Only Thing Good = Location”
Reviews.Author: slindsey_tx
Reviews.Content: The ad says 'free wireless internet' - you can only access the net in the 100 sq ft lobby. Ad says 'heated pool' - the hot tub was luke -warm the pool was very cold. The whole staff is rude and lazy. If you are looking for a great location and that's all â€“ this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming, Dumpy Place”
Reviews.Author: TravelDragonFl
Reviews.Content: Well, I picked this place because they allowed three adults in the room (very rare in KW, most places make you get two rooms) and the place was right on Duval. Cheap, last minute rate and it had its own parking down the street (another rare-ity in KW). All I can say is that you get what you pay for. Living in Florida, I have become used to big bugs (even the BEST places can have those run inside), the occasional rat, mold in the shower, etc. therefore, not much bothers me. The place is OLD and does need a revamp, but nothing I could not deal with. The only thing that really bothered me was having to fill out a registration card (have not been asked to do THAT in YEARS!) and asked to pay a $10.00 cash key deposit. I felt like I was transported 20 years back in time and not in a good way. Other than that, the place was ok, the view was cool and I was only in the room to shower and sleep. Good if you want a cheap room but don't expect much else from this place.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY is too mild a word to describe this dump”
Reviews.Author: floridalovers007
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for my job and stay in all kinds of places from basic budget roadside motels to world class hotels. This hotel is by far the worst I have ever stayed in, including one that had a pizza box full of crusts under the bed and one that had 2 four inch long dead cockroaches on the floor. The ONLY good thing you can say about this place is it's location and that's only if you are into loud, all-night partying because it's right on Duval Street which is Key West's version of Bourbon Street in New Orleans. The sheets were not changed before we got there but the bed was made. There were 2 large gobs of hair (not ours) in the bed, food stains on the sheets, a large brown stain on the bedspread, moldy shower, the toilet overflowed the first morning we were there so we had to use the bathroom by the pool that didn't have any toilet paper (for 2 days despite reporting it), the locks on the doors didn't work and there was a hamper-cart full of dirty sheets in the hall outside our door the entire time we were there. The upholstered chairs were so filthy you definitely wouldn't want to sit on them, the airconditioner sounded like a screeching jet engine and the staff is completely indifferent. The owner/manager, however was not indifferent, he was RUDE and threatened to call the police on us when we complained after swearing at us because we had the audacity to want clean sheets. He actually told us we should have slept in the other bed! I am disputing the charges with my cc company because we left and they would not refund the 2 nights that we did not stay there. We spent the rest of the time at a lovely B&B called Azul that I would highly recommend. Do yourself a favor and stay at a Key West Guest House or B&B and avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict11
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is directly on Duval street and next to a wonderful pizza place, in my experience, the hotel staff does not act like they want your business. From the first minute I arrived, I felt like the staff looked down upon me and treated me with disrespect. The rooms are adequate. The locks on the doors don't work very well and there is mold and cracked tiles in the bathroom. This is where I (and two other rooms) got charged for things that we had absolutely had no control over. The police became involved, but, unfortunately, they could not do anything except advise us to pursue legal action. All in all, I do not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: jake∥kles
Reviews.Content: We booked february7-10 with another couple also (2 rooms). the staff was OK but not overly friendly, the rooms were OK, towels & sheets clean overall cleanliness OK---No bugs or rodents that we could see. A brewed coffee pot in the lobby would have been nice as all the had was instant coffee, although dunkin donuts was across the street. Location was wonderful sun deck & pool/jacuzzi area nice touch for downtown duval street. The rooms seemed a bit dated but when you see the rest of key west (needed to get acclimated) it was ok for the money. Location is everything and pegasus was great to come back to after partying all night. The jacuzzi felt great the next morning but could have been a little cleaner. The Walgreens 2 doors down was convenient. The "damn good staff" cleaning crew were nice & we made sure we left a tip for them everyday and the room was always clean to come back to. We would consider staying here again the $200/night seems like what you would pay for $70 back home but in key west you are definitely paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - not bad”
Reviews.Author: Highclasslowrent
Reviews.Content: This is nothing to write home about but it was a great price for the location during Key West Race Week when hotels are priced high. We had a decent room, clean but not new. The pool was OK but not heated.

Reviews.Title: “Location good - accommodations not-so-good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove to Key West on impulse (we were in Miami) and had no hotel room booked. We spent the afternoon on Duval St and didn't want to move our car, so looked for a hotel on Duval. We found the Pegasus. The hotel was sold out, save for one room, which the desk clerk showed to us before renting it to us. We assume this room was at one time a manager's apartment. It was a small room with one double bed but it served our purposes. After walking Duval St for a few more hours, we came back to take a swim. The pool/deck area is very nice in appearance. While we were floating around in the pool, however, we saw a rat run across the deck. Yuck. And if there was any chance we were wrong about it being a rat, we were able to confirm it a bit later when the rat (I hope it was the same one) came back across the deck and climbed the lattice. I gotta say, it was pretty difficult to leave the pool and go back to our room and sleep comfortably after seeing a rat. We reported the rat to the girl at the front desk, but she didn't seem real interested. So, as far as the title I gave this review, if you're looking for location (and the deck area does look over Duval St), this hotel is a good choice. But if you're more concerned about sanitary room conditions, I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eatapeach
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I recently stayed at the Pegasus. We had a very nice stay and the service was good. It is an "international" hotel and all of the employees are foreign exchange students. The hotel is undergoing a facelift and our accomadations were fresh, clean, and well kept. My only complaints would be that the TV's could be bigger and the beds a little firmer. However for the price and location it can't be beat. Make sure you visit Mr. Z's restaurant next door for the best Philly cheesesteak and omlettes. They deliver 24/7 and the prices are great!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let negative reviews alter decision”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews about the Pegasus AFTER I had booked it for 3 days. So that made me a bit apprehensive when we checked in. Thankfully it lived far past the negative reviews. Room was clean, including the sheets, first thing I checked. Bathrooms were clean. Towels were not extra large, but they did the job. Staff was friendly. As they say in Realestate, it's all about LOCATION!!!! Smack in the middle of Duval St. We parked the car, and walked for our 3 day stay. Considering the prices of rooms in Key West during "season", The Pegasus worked just fine. For 150.00 there's no better deal, with this location. Sure that buys a 4+ star hotel in other areas. If you don't have the $$$ Key West isn't for you, at least during the winter months, and summer, you don't want to be there. Cane season starts June 1st.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not bad”
Reviews.Author: Mikepc2fla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pegasus for a long weekend. Fair at best cust. service is to be expected. Room smelled of straight mildew, window style a/c was loud as can be, bed was the worst I think I've ever slept on. The good thing about the hotel is it is smack dab in the middle of Duval St. Which is evident at night! You can hear EVERYTHING going on on the street below. Other than that there isn't much more positive to say about the hotel. Unless you're going with a large group of friends and plan on staying out till 3 a.m. and just need a place to crash (the floor would be the best place to sleep in the room) I'd def. not recomending this hotel...although it was the cheapest I found avail....I now know why! Use caution! you've been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip in mid-May to Key West as a surprise for my wife. We didn't have $300 - $400 to spend for a night in a hotel, so despite the less than glowing reviews I read about the Pegasus, I booked a night there by phone for about $150. The girl said we could book another night once we arrived if we wanted too as they were not too busy that weekend. The approach from the side street is kind of grubby, the lobby is small but efficient, and our room with king-sized bed was dated but OK for us to crash in and have a shower in the morning. The roof-top pool and hot-tub near the back of the deck were refreshing, and the tables and chairs at the front that overlook Duval St. were great. We had a bird's eye view of the partying on the below and we were able to figure out which direction we wanted to start (being right across from Margaritaville didn't hurt). 10 blocks to Mallory Square in one direction, 10 blocks the other way to explore too. Coming home at 4:00 and a quick swim before bed was great. (We were politely asked to leave the pool because if they let us swim at that time, they have to let everyone swim at that time, and I guess things can get pretty rowdy). We stayed a second night.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, shabby, but oh so central..!”
Reviews.Author: sammyk
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Key West on Memorial Day weekend, with no accommodation booked. We're British - we didn't know, OK?! So while we'd dreamed of shuttered colonial guest houses with sumptious fruit pancake breakfasts, we ended up in the Pegasus at $160 a night. I'm glad I didn't read these reviews first, but we actually found it to be OK. Dreadful shower (you had to run around in it to get wet!), noisy air-con and shabby, dated rooms, but ours was clean and Duval is right outside your door. We were grateful for a bed, and the Pegasus did the job just fine. There's a pool that we never used, but it looked good enough, and the guy on the front deask was really helful in finding us free parking. So don't get your hopes up too high for the Pegasus, but don't despair either - it's not too bad and while you could do so much better with a bigger budget, not on a holiday weekend, you could also do an awful lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap (by Key West standards at least) and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: susieg77
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to discover how expensive Key West hotels are. Even a dump charges $200 per room per night, so I had to adjust my expectations a bit when I stayed here! The big positive with the Pegasus is location - it is literally a stone's throw from everything, and you can stumble home safely post-Duval Crawl in a matter of 2 minutes. Another big plus is the roof-top pool, hot tub, and terrace, which is a great place to chill and recharge before heading out on the town in the evening. Negatives? Probably the rooms. Key West is a place to party, so apart from sleeping and washing, you will not spend any amount of time in your room. Having said that the rooms are fairly basic, the decor quite dated, and yes the towels will only just about cover your modesty, but hey, that's Key West for you. Even though I literally rolled into bed at 4am one night, I noticed that my bed had seen a lot of action, and was minus a few functioning springs. As for the hygeine, well it looked pretty clean to me but I had my beer goggles on so my verdict is not to be trusted!! Our room had a fridge which we were glad of at the end of a hot and humid day out and about. Overall not the worst place in Key West, and at least you get to keep your dollars for tipping the "ladies" at Bourbon 801, and having a rum runner or dozen.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Expensive Dump on Earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Pegasus hotel is one of the worst establishments I have ever stayed on vacation. The service was beyond horrible and the quality of my room was disgusting. I found pubic hairs, yellow stains and spiders in my bed. There was no water pressure in the shower, the toilet ran all night and the towels barely covered my body. Customer service not only yelled at me for demanding a new room they charged me double. Needless to say, DON'T STAY at the PEGASUS motel.... you will be sorry.

HotelInfo.Name: Pegasus International Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 501 Southard Street, Key West, FL 33040
